meanings.definition: A tool with a rotating cutting tip for boring holes.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a wimble to drill precise holes in the wood.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy a new wimble for my woodworking projects.
meanings.sent3: The wimble made a perfect hole in the wall, just like magic!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes followed the wimble as it spun through the wood, creating a tunnel of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The shiny wimble gleamed in the sunlight, ready to carve into the oak.

meanings.definition: To bore a hole with a wimble.
meanings.sent1: He will wimble through the metal sheet to make room for the bolt.
meanings.sent2: Please wimble carefully to avoid damaging the surface.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to wimble through the nut but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her words wimbled through his mind, leaving a trail of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The drill wimbled effortlessly through the soft clay, creating a perfect circle.

meanings.sent1: The wimble hole in the fence allowed the rabbit to escape.
meanings.sent2: I peeked through the wimble hole to see what was on the other side.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat squeezed through the wimble hole and disappeared into the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a wimble hole, full of thoughts swirling in endless circles.
meanings.sent5: The old tree had a wimble hole at its base, a secret entrance to a hidden world.
